other_info.Contributor: James Woods, John Flynn, Victoria Tennant, Brian Dennehy

title: It's a best smeller,
content: Best Seller was a minor hit movie in 1988 with the odd pairing of James Woods as the criminal who wants his life of crime immortalized in a novel written by ex-cop and author played by Brian Denehey.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2022

title: Verified Purchase
content: You get a buddy genre picture mixed with witty banter and moderate action.  It's neither excellent nor mediocre.  But it is truly a Best Seller.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2011

title: Surprisingly Good Movie
content: I love James Woods and also like Brian Dennehy,  but despite there being two excellent actors in it,  the movie's description made  it sound kind of  dated, a 15+ year old cop drama that I had never heard of. But I thought, hey, for $2.99 for Vid on Demand, what do I have to lose!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2019

title: Verified Purchase
content: Wow, I was really surprised what a great film this was:  of course  two of my favorite actors were excellent as usual, but the film, direction, story line, dialogue and  cinematography was really good, to the point where it was hard to believe it had been made so long ago.  Excellent movie, fast-paced and unpredictable, with James Woods playing a character who was both oddly sympathetic and at the same time, a cold blooded killer--who else could have played this role but him!  The development of the bond between these two men--the author/cop and the killer--was fascinating to watch.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2022

title: Entertaining
content: A pretty entertaining movie. I thought the cop's daughter was the dumbest character in this movie. You know there are bad guys out there and you don't have any skills or a gun to fight them. Why would you come out of the room and run into arms of the bad guys' boss and have the man who saved her get killed?? She is old enough to realize the situation even knowing her father was down there. What if the boss killed his father too? I guess they didn't want James Wood's character to live, because he killed too many people although they were mostly bad guys. But still wish they made the ending a little more believable...
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2015

title: Verified Purchase
content: This was the second time I have bought this DVD because in the first one the second last chapter of the film wouldn't play on my DVD player, so I bought this one. The same thing happened with this one. It appears that there is a manufacturing defect that Olive Films should correct as soon as possible. I wonder if anyone else has experienced this problem?
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2022

title: DVD was great but...
content: Of the numerous films that Larry Cohen has written, but not directed, Best Seller is probably the best of the bunch.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2016

title: Verified Purchase
content: If Cohen had directed Best Seller, the satirical elements of a corporation engaging in a string of murders would probably have taken a more front-and-center role in the plot. I can imagine Michael Moriarty as a truly unhinged version of Cleve, chewing the scenery, and savoring some of the character’s more outrageous moments. That version of the film that only exists in my mind would have been great. The actual film, as directed by John Flynn, isn’t great, but it is very good.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2022

title: Best Seller is probably the best of the bunch
content: The rest of my review is on my site: http://obsessivemovienerd.com/2014/02/20/the-cohen-case-files-best-seller-1987/
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2021

title: Verified Purchase
content: Good acting and writing. Easy to watch
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2022

title: A Superb Thriller
content: Brian Dennehy and James Woods give spectacular performances as the good cop and the killer play off each other throughout this mystery.  Did Clive (Woods) do everything he said he did, or is he making things up.  Will Dennis (Dennehy) write a bestseller off the information he gathers?  I watch this one at least once a year.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020

title: Verified Purchase
content: Worst movie I've seen Dennehy in. Woods was not believable in the role and their chemistry was nothing. Stupid, mundane story with guns and good actors that had their talents wasted. I will blame it on the script and the direction. It's to watch only if you have nothing else to watch or do. Two stars for production values, good sets and that's about it.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022

title: Worse than predictable. Stupid situations and shallow relationships. Guns, if you like them.
content: Good movie with great acting by both men.  James Woods gave a great performance of a true sociopath with a human side and odd bursts of a need to be liked and respected from time to time.  Sometimes he scared you to death and other times you liked -- or wanted to like -- him.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2016

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is an excellent James Woods movie.  He is so cool in this one.  His character is so full of confidence.  This is another movie I loan out and fail to get back.  I need another one now.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021

title: Good movie with great acting by both men
content: I thought it was one of the best movies I have watched, even the second time around.

title: Verified Purchase
content: While the premise content is weak, these two sizzle together. Woods' ability to transform from a pleasant, persuasive, character to the menacing sociopath he is, is fun to watch.

title: Verified Purchase
content: The story line is weak and it's almost impossible to believe that this cop would allow this character to continue, once he discovers his past involvement in his personal life. That almost ruined it for me.

title: Loved it
content: Great Movie with Great Character Actors.  My favorite James Woods flick.  Simple action fare but fun and well told.  Woods makes for a great assassin with an agenda and Dennehy is believable as a cop turned writer.  Some great scenes of Woods plying his trade and he is a sympathetic character when he stands up to protect Dennehy's daughter toward the end.  One of those good movies I wanted for my personal favorites collection.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2016

title: Verified Purchase
content: great movie
